intro: Galium kinuta, commonly known as Japanese bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium kinuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
